div1.p: Rath invites Hench to lunch with himself and General Grant to discuss the preservation of Camp Lazear.

Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
If, as you suggested in your fine letter of
January 11, your secretary forwards your mail, this
should reach you while you are in Cuba. I trust that
you and Mrs. Hench are enjoying the International
Conference on Vitamins and Metabolism.

It is my pleasure to extend to you an invi-
tation to join General Grant and me for lunch on
Saturday, February 23. I suggest that you call our
new office at 712 Jackson Place, N.W. (phone NAtional
2215) when you arrive. Subject to final confirmation,
will you plan to meet us at 12:30 p.m. at 712 Jackson
Place. We are looking forward to discussing your very
interesting project.
